title: Aria ozoo edepi ri
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: Once long ago there lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a terrible drought in the land, until one little girl remembering her grandmother, went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food to eat. The drought broke, but no one believed that it was because of the rain bird. It took the near death of the girls’ father to bring the people to their senses.

title: Ngwana wa tlou wa go rata go tseba kudu
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had small stubby noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks! He was curious about everything. He asked questions whenever he met other animals and wanted to know so many things, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged him to go and find out what the crocodile has for dinner at the river. While there, curious baby elephant encountered a crocodile and their meeting got very interesting. Find out what his curiosity led to by continuing to read the story.

title: Ngwedi le kepisi
author: /author/noni
summary: Do you like to wear a cap on a sunny day? Find out who else wears a cap in this story.

title: Tlowana ya go rata go tseba
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had small stubby noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks! He was curious about everything. He asked questions whenever he met other animals and wanted to know so many things, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged him to go and find out what the crocodile has for dinner at the river. While there, curious baby elephant encountered a crocodile and their meeting got very interesting. Find out what his curiosity led to by continuing to read the story.

title: Bana ba kerese
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Ngwana wa tlou wa go rata go tseba kudu
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had small stubby noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks! He was curious about everything. He asked questions whenever he met other animals and wanted to know so many things, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged him to go and find out what the crocodile has for dinner at the river. While there, curious baby elephant encountered a crocodile and their meeting got very interesting. author: /author/meera-tendolkar

summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Mpotše… Gona Bjale! Lethabo Le Manyami
author: /author/madhav-chavan
summary: This story talks about what things make us happy and what makes us sad.

title: Sekolo sa Sethokgweng
author: /author/madhav-chavan
/author/meera-tendolkar
summary: The animals in the jungle rush to the new school with great enthusiasm. What do you think happened after that?

title: Ditšhwene tšeo di be go di e ya kua le kua
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary:
People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots. They begin to look and behave like apes. The baboon families cannot live together anymore. 
The All Rights Reserved McCall Smith version is available here.

title: Litsoene tseneng litsama ka tsela ena le ena
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary:
People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots. They begin to look and behave like apes. The baboon families cannot live together anymore. 
The All Rights Reserved McCall Smith version is available here.

title: Limane le Limazane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Mosali oa Sefate
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Moqebelo hone ho chesa haholo
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Ts'oanelo le ntja ea nkoapo.
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. After gathering the wood they decide to swim. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuse to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens.

title: Lits'oene tse ne li ea koana le koana
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots, and they begin to look and behave like apes. Then these baboon families find that they no longer want to live together.

title: Nkhono le Hlompho ea nkhang hampe
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A young girl’s grandmother makes her a beautiful makgabe. Her friends are jealous and trick her because they want the makgabe. Then the girl is eaten by a snake. Fortunately her grandmother saves the day.

title: Mashilo le Mashilwane
author: /author/bathokwa-book-club
summary: Mashilo and Mashilwane were brothers. Mashilo became jealous when their father gave his little brother more cattle. Mashilwane wass kind and got a price for his kindness.

/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story describes what we can do with our bodies. Read more to see what we cannot do with our bodies.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Monna o motelele-telele
author: /author/cornelius-gulere
summary: The story tells of the dilemma of a man who was very tall. Everything around him was small. He had to make his own things befitting his height.
copyrightHolder: © Text: Ugandan Community Libraries Association © Illustrations: African Storybook Initiative

title: Mosidi le Diphiri
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Tlowana marata go itse
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had small stubby noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks! He was curious about everything. He asked questions whenever he met other animals and wanted to know so many things, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged him to go and find out what the crocodile has for dinner at the river. While there, curious baby elephant encountered a crocodile and their meeting got very interesting. Find out what his curiosity led to by continuing to read the story.

title: Bana ba kerese
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Refiloe le dikoko tsa gagwe
author: /author/marion-drew
summary: Refiloe’s sister is getting married. It is the first wedding in the Tenane family. Refiloe’s chickens are very dirty and she decides to wash them for the wedding. The chickens do not like being washed. Refiloe cannot find her chickens when it is time for the wedding, but everyone is in for a big surprise.

title: Anansi le Khudu
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't  want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites him to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food.

title: Mokibo
author: /author/mary-nabire
/author/tessa-welch
summary: A poem about a girl who loves to dance. Her teachers find this irritating, but her mother encourages her talent.

title: Mogote wa Lamatlhatso Motshegare
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: The Rain Bird
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: The Smell Thief
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: A baker objects to people smelling his delicious buns, bread and cakes without buying them. He gets so angry at these 'smell thiefs' that he takes one of the frequent 'offenders' to court. Justice is done in a way that makes the baker reflect on himself.

title: IKENY NI AKIRU
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: Once long ago there lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a terrible drought in the land, until one little girl remembering her grandmother, went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food to eat. The drought broke, but no one believed that it was because of the rain bird. It took the near death of the girls’ father to bring the people to their senses.

title: Intak'emvula
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: Inyoni enisa imvula
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: Die reënvoël
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: Aria ozoo edepi ri
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: Nonyana ea pula
author: /author/joanne-bloch-retold-folktale
summary: There lived a beautiful bird deep in the forest, a bird that made the rain fall. But people no longer believed in this bird, and stopped taking care of it. There was a  terrible drought in the land, until one little girl went into the forest to find the rain bird and give it food. The drought ended, but people still did not want to believe in the rain bird.

title: Okalakukala
author: /author/reviva-schermbrucker
summary: This book consists of descriptive sentences with photographs of everyday brown objects.
copyrightHolder: Reviva Schermbrucker, Sue Kramer and PRAESA, 2002

title: Neymar ma emu taa Afrika ri
author: /author/benard-agasi
summary: An imaginary description of footballer Neymar da Silva Santos’ visit to African countries to demonstrate specific soccer skills.

title: Ondua mupira avizuri
author: /author/joseph-ejoyi
summary: Joseph teaches us ball control and other soccer skills.

title: OMU ONZIRI
author: /author/abuko-florence-gladys-gelenga
summary: Orodriyo came to visit a family ,found they were planning to sell a cock on a market day.He thought they were cheesing the cock for his meal and demanded that a red pepper be put in it.Since the family was  preparing porridge  for Breakfast and they put red pepper in it.He coughed and shed tears, when asked what was wrong, he said, whenever he thinks of his deceased relatives he sheds tears.

title: O'guo ma drileba yo!!
author: /author/abuko-florence-gladys-gelenga
summary: Thieves used to disturb Buatru's family, find out what he did?.

title: Buku mavile eda ni ri
author: /author/oku-modesto
summary: A book with simple words and pictures.

title: Avitaa ndu ndu diyi
author: /author/ajarubo-philiam
summary: Pictures of different types of playing

title: Ebio  eji `ba yi ni a`diko  yi awa
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Long ago, the sky god kept all stories locked up in a wooden box. People asked clever Anansi to ask the sky god for the stories. The sky god agreed, but only if Anansi performed three seemingly impossible tasks.

title: E`yo ebio ma pa yin i ovuzu izia izia aro ri
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi the Spider loves eating, but doesn’t want to do the work to cook a meal. He thinks of a clever way in which his friends can alert him when the food is ready. But unfortunately the plan backfires, and he ends up with very thin legs, and no food at all.

title: Nonkungu pi Androo be
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: A’U PI YUKU BE
author: /author/ann-nduku
summary: Hen borrows  a needle from Eagle and loses it. As revenge, Eagle always snatches Hen’s chicks whenever an opportunity arises because of the needle.

title: Adiko kayia pini ‘ima zukulu be ri
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Dede ma A’bua
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The little girl is curious as she watches her grandma preparing to ripen bananas.  Where grandma stores the bananas to ripen remains top secret to the disappointment of her grandchild. But how long does it take before the grandchild discovers grandma’s secret?

title: Ini eca Opio vile angua ngoni ngonia
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Anji afa Akazavile ri
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Amagu Pa Ima Ati
author: /author/kanyiva-sandi
summary: Musau’s father, Syonzola, was used to getting drunk almost every night and would pretend that he was being attacked. When villagers would come, they would find that it was only a joke.  One night, however, he was actually attacked by a hyena and was saved by his son Musau.

title: Okporua eyo nzepi ri
author: /author/caroline-lentupuru
summary: Two little girls went out to collect firewood and met with a giant who pretended to need help with firewood. The giant was about to lie and take one of the little girls when the little girl identified herself.

title: Sara yi a’u ‘bani ojii ‘dii pie
author: /author/marion-drew
summary: Refiloe’s sister is getting married. It is the first wedding in the Tenane family. Refiloe’s chickens are very dirty and she decides to wash them for the wedding. The chickens do not like being washed. Refiloe cannot find her chickens when it is time for the wedding, but everyone is in for a big surprise.

title: Onyukunyu pi drikulu be
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: Mr. Fly and Mr. Big head were two great friends. Then one day they argued about who could swim across the river.  They decided to go out and swim to prove who was right.  Mr. Big Head failed to swim. Mr. Fly laughed so much that his mouth became wider and wider…

title: Arakiliko
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo-christopher
summary: Young boys like going out into forests to hunt for birds. They use catapults for hunting birds.  This is a story about a young boy who found and shot a Hornbill as he was walking through the village. A Hornbill is commonly found in forests in tropical Africa. He was very excited and offered the bird to an old man in the village who liked eating anything given to him.

title: Ibio pi Ondoa be
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: The sky god decides to  give Anansi the spider  a pot of wisdom. He is so excited by all he learns from looking into it that he wants to hide it in a tree so that he can keep it all to himself. Unfortunately for him (but fortunately for the people of the world), the pot falls and breaks.

title: Ebio pi, gaagaa pie azini eyio pie
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. They uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles.  This seems like the end for him, but he finds a way out.

title: Ibio pi Roko be
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi is poor, but his friend Rabbit is a prosperous farmer. Anansi is jealous, and finds a way to take over his friend’s farm. He makes a lot of money selling his friend’s fruit and vegetables. But one day on the way home from the market, something happens to change his fortunes again.

title: Ebio pi Okukua be
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't  want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites him to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food.

title: Agu azi izu ni
author: /author/cornelius-gulere
summary: The story tells of the dilemma of a man who was very tall. Everything around him was small. He had to make his own things befitting his height.
copyrightHolder: © Text: Ugandan Community Libraries Association © Illustrations: African Storybook Initiative

title: Pati efi
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: In one of a faraway village, there was a very beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. It was difficult for the parents to decide on a right suitor for their daughter. However, in their compound they also had a very sweet fruit. They, therefore, decided that their daughter would be given to whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.

title: ‘Aza’bo, Ba aza be ri
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was once a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. As they looked for a place to set up their new home, they encountered some thieves who had a lot of stolen money and some household goods. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Ojua pi Obau be
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Aria anyu ma angu e`dapi ri ni arioti ofezuri
author: /author/zulu-folktale
summary: A young hunter follows the lead of a honeyguide bird to a bees’ hive full of ripe honey. Instead of rewarding the bird with a share of the honey, he chases it away. The next time the young man tries to find honey, the bird gets his revenge!

title: Agupi oko ri oku oko ri
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Oku Pati ru ri
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Agu Anitua be e’yo ni ndele ra
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a young man who thought he was wiser than anyone young or old around him. He said so to everyone including his wife. However, his wife’s father proved to him that “old is wiser than young”.

title: Anzi iri abiri ni nde ra `diyi
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This is a counting story. Work out how many cupcakes Ben and Thabo left for Granny.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Ma Pati Avitavileri ngoa ya?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Bunty yi Bubbly be
author: /author/sorit-gupto
summary: Bunty does not like soap, so she refuses to clean up. One night she has a dream. What happens after that?

title: Mi eri e’yo ma Ruadria
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Imbapi Govile i
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher.

title: Opi aria yi ni
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: O’du Azia Alu Driipi tu Ondresi ri
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Candiru pi dri`bi ifi na `diyi be
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Ojata ayiko ru ri
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Pati Enyati Olivu niri ma Azakoopi ri
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Mudhni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Abaza agu oka dipiri ni esuleri
author: /author/ugandan-folktale
summary: A local chief summoned a famous blacksmith to his palace. The chief wanted the blacksmith to build a real man out of steel, one who could cry tears, and bleed human blood. The blacksmith was alarmed by the chief's request. He knew he could not refuse the chief, but how was he to complete this impossible task?

title: Ojimata Acipi 'Dosi 'Dasi 'Diyi
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots, and they begin to look and behave like apes. Then these baboon families find that they no longer want to live together.

title: Dramani pi Draru be
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are mistreated by their uncle and run away to live in a cave. They have heard that cannibals live in the hills near their cave, so the children have to very careful. While Demane goes out to look for food Demazane stays in the cave, with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell. Will Demazane listen to her brother?

title: Ehigoosi hy’omuŋeesi
author: /author/ugandan-folktale
summary: A local chief summoned a famous blacksmith to his palace. The chief wanted the blacksmith to build a real man out of steel, one who could cry tears, and bleed human blood. The blacksmith was alarmed by the chief's request. He knew he could not refuse the chief, but how was he to complete this impossible task?

title: Nakungu n’Embulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Anansi omunafu
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi the Spider loves eating, but doesn’t want to do the work to cook a meal. He thinks of a clever way in which his friends can alert him when their food is ready. But unfortunately the plan backfires and the result is the reason why spiders have long thin legs.

title: Haŋambi, Nahinywamalwa ni Wagoona
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Haŋambi n’Ehudu
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't  want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites him to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food.

title: Omusinde omuleeŋi obugali
author: /author/cornelius-gulere
summary: The story tells of the dilemma of a man who was very tall. Everything around him was small. He had to make his own things befitting his height.
copyrightHolder: © Text: Ugandan Community Libraries Association © Illustrations: African Storybook Initiative

title: Ehibala
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: In one of a faraway village, there was a very beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. It was difficult for the parents to decide on a right suitor for their daughter. However, in their compound they also had a very sweet fruit. They, therefore, decided that their daughter would be given to whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.

title: Muŋubebe
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was once a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. As they looked for a place to set up their new home, they encountered some thieves who had a lot of stolen money and some household goods. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Mulongo ni Namunyu
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Engoho ni Haŋungu
author: /author/ann-nduku
summary: Hen borrows  a needle from Eagle and loses it. As revenge, Eagle always snatches Hen’s chicks whenever an opportunity arises because of the needle.

title: Engeri eyi owiire wajamo mu hitahere hya Watindi
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Namudira n’Ehita
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Musa ataasa semwana
author: /author/kanyiva-sandi
summary: Musau’s father, Syonzola, was used to getting drunk almost every night and would pretend that he was being attacked. When villagers would come, they would find that it was only a joke.  One night, however, he was actually attacked by a hyena and was saved by his son Musau.

title: Nakungu n’Embulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Olugano lw’omuhaana ow’ebeere erala
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a man who lived happily with his wife. One day he took a walk into the forest. He met with a very beautiful girl. He immediately fell in love with her and wanted to marry her. However, she told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She therefore suggested to him to go and cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they would marry. So the man run as fast as he could to cut off his wife’s breast, and returned to the forest. But he did not find the beautiful girl to give her the breast. He was very perturbed. What happened to this man? - See more at: http://preview18.bluematrix.co.za/stories/girl-one-breast#sthash.4QHCQvFb.dpuf

title: Enguge ejerwenga eno ni neera
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary:
People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots. They begin to look and behave like apes. The baboon families cannot live together anymore. 
The All Rights Reserved McCall Smith version is available here.

title: Haŋambi n'Esega
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi is poor, but his friend Rabbit is a prosperous farmer. Anansi is jealous, and finds a way to take over his friend’s farm. He makes a lot of money selling his friend’s fruit and vegetables. But one day on the way home from the market, something happens to change his fortunes again.

title: Gamusi omusomesa
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher.

title: Habaha w’enyuni
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Omuhasi womu musaala
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Eŋaaŋa
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo-christopher
summary: Young boys like going out into forests to hunt for birds. They use catapults for hunting birds.  This is a story about a young boy who found and shot a Hornbill as he was walking through the village. A Hornbill is commonly found in forests in tropical Africa. He was very excited and offered the bird to an old man in the village who liked eating anything given to him.

title: Ehyegulo hu lwomukaaga olwaliho ebbugumu
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Wasoŋera ni Hirimutwe
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: Mr. Fly and Mr. Big head were two great friends. Then one day they argued about who could swim across the river.  They decided to go out and swim to prove who was right.  Mr. Big Head failed to swim. Mr. Fly laughed so much that his mouth became wider and wider…

title: Ohweyobusa Ohusangaasa
author: /author/ignatius-mubbalya
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Nanjoosi n’efiiri edatu
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Sibahwana
author: /author/rukia-nantale
summary: After Simbegwire's mother died, she and her father did everything together. They were happy until Simbegwire’s father wanted to marry a new wife. This woman treats the girl badly, and Simbegwire runs away from home.

title: Omusaala  ogwaŋonia ehyalo hy’ebugaado
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite Baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Muhdni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Omulagiriri w'aŋali omudungere n’omwegalulo gugwe
author: /author/zulu-folktale
summary: A young hunter follows a honey-guide bird to a bees’ hive full of ripe honey. Instead of rewarding the bird with a share of the honey, he chases it away. The next time the young man tries to find honey, the bird gets its revenge!

title: Omukeeka gwa Akai Omutoongole
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost in the hills.

title: Embusi, Embwa n’Eῃombe
author: /author/fabian-wakholi
summary: Goat, Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi, but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising. And as a result of what happened, each animal develops a different reaction to motor vehicles.

title: OMUHAYIRE
author: /author/mulongo
summary: An old person was told to look for a  new backcloth unfortunately the backcloth which was brought was old.

title: JOJO   N’EŊOMBE
author: /author/isiira-patrick
summary: All children should learn to love and care their animals kept at home.

title: EBIITIIRA MU HITEHERE HYEFE
author: /author/yusuf
/author/yvonne
/author/desire
/author/arafat
/author/judith
/author/susan
summary: The story describes  how huts are made and where they are found mostly.

title: EBIITIIRA MU HITEHERE HYEFE
author: /author/yusuf
/author/yvonne
/author/desire
/author/arafat
/author/judith
/author/susan
summary: The story describes  how huts are made and where they are found mostly.

title: ABEEBI B’EMIYEMBE
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
summary: The four boys stole some mangoes from a nearby place  due to hunger after escaping from school.

title: Ehibbwe  ehiyala n’amapeera agajujuma
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: A hungry jackal comes across an orchard where a ripe bunch of grapes is hanging from a branch. The jackal jumps up to grab the grapes but he falls hard on his back. He keeps jumping even higher and each time he falls even harder on his back. Will he ever get the grapes?

title: Ese nyumirwa
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A bilingual text in English and Kiswahili, about all the things a young girl enjoys doing.

title: Ehibbwe n’ Eryuba
author: /author/traditional-san-story
summary: Lazy Jackal falls in love with the sun and wants to take her home to meet his father. They set off on the journey with Jackal carrying the sun on his back, but they don’t get very far.

title: Amago gange ninange
author: /author/waako-joshua
/author/cornelius-gulere
summary: A story about a little boy’s adventures with a very unusual family!

title: Namwima
author: /author/matthews-m-wanga
summary: Namukhaywa and her husband have 6 daughters, and he really wants a son. When she gives birth to a twin boy and girl she decides to hide her 7th daughter and only takes the son home to her husband. The twins grow up with separate lives, but one day they meet. Will they discover the truth?

title: Omusinde  owamenya ɳa  yenyene
author: /author/carlos-kanembera
summary: This is the story of a man who didn't want to live near other people. The man and his wife moved to a remote house, far away from everyone. This isolation has terrible consequences.

title: Engeri eyi Ege Lyaɳoniamo Eɳuusi
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
/author/judith-baker
summary: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away. Dove saves Little Ant’s life. How does Little Ant thank Dove?

title: Omuliro
author: /author/deborah-namugosa
/author/beatrice-nabune
/author/alison-tukei
/author/rose-sabano
summary: This story was developed and written by teachers at Mugulu Integrated Primary School in Busolwe Sub-County, Butaleja District, Uganda.
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Esambo eyi wire wajaambo muhitehere Hy’Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: There is no night time in Opio's village. One day he goes hunting and arrives at a place he doesn't know. When night falls there, Opio thinks he has gone blind. Then he discovers the truth and likes night so much that he takes it to his own village.

title: MASANJA MAAPI
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo
summary: This is a tongue twister rhyme in Lunyole language.

title: Let's go
author: /author/carole-bloch

copyrightHolder: Thembinkosi Kohli, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Listen
author: /author/carole-bloch

copyrightHolder: Jean Fullalove, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Little and big

copyrightHolder: Vian Oelofsen, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Two

copyrightHolder: Carole Bloch, Richard MacIntosh and PRAESA, 2002

title: Anansi and Turtle
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Anansi and Vulture
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi is poor, but his friend Rabbit is a prosperous farmer. Anansi is jealous, and finds a way to take over his friend’s farm. He makes a lot of money selling Rabbit's fruit and vegetables. But one day on the way home from the market, something happens to change Anansi's fortunes again.

title: Lazy Anansi
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi the Spider loves eating, but doesn’t want to do the work to cook a meal. He thinks of a clever way in which his friends can alert him when their food is ready. But unfortunately the plan backfires and the result is the reason why spiders have long thin legs.

title: Anansi and Wisdom
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Anansi ne Wampungu

summary: Long ago, the sky god kept all stories locked up in a wooden box. People asked clever Anansi to ask the sky god for the stories. The sky god agreed, but only if Anansi performed three seemingly impossible tasks.

title: Nonkungu na Imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Samaki mkarimu
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: Nosisa lives with her mother and father in a small village. Her father is a rich man who bullies Nosisa's mother and treats her like a child. Nosisa's mother cannot take the bad treatment anymore and runs away from her daughter and husband back to her family. After she left, Mpunzi, Nosisa's father, treats her the same way he treated her mother. Mpunzi marries again and the woman treats Nosisa badly. Nosisa takes refuge at the local stream and while there, she is pleasantly surprised by a big fish which turns out to be her mother. The fish comforts her and feeds her with food, fruit and vegetables. Her stepmother is suspicious and follows Nosisa to the stream one day. She notices what happens and plots to have the fish captured. She asks her husband to capture the fish as the traditional doctor suggested eating it will help her conceive. Mpunzi and his subjects captures the fish and they have it for dinner with his wife. They leave the bones on the table for Nosisa to clean and she's devastated when she finds out. She goes back to the stream and cried thinking that her mother had been eaten. While at the river, a bird tells her to pick up the bones and throw them in the river. A miracle happens after that! Read on to find out what happens in this compelling folktale!

title: Mwezi na Kofia
author: /author/noni
summary: Do you like to wear a cap on a sunny day? Find out who else wears a cap in this story.

title: Anansi na Hekima
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: The sky god decides to give Anansi the spider a pot of wisdom. He is so excited by all he learns from looking into it that he wants to hide it in a tree so that he can keep it all to himself. Unfortunately for him (but fortunately for the people of the world), the pot falls and breaks.

title: Anansi, Kunguru na Mamba
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Kisirusiru, mjinga
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was once a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. As they looked for a place to set up their new home, they encountered some thieves who had a lot of stolen money and some household goods. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Anansi na Kasa
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Mulongo na Fisi
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Kisasi cha Asali-Ndege
author: /author/zulu-folktale
summary: A young hunter follows the lead of a honeyguide bird to a bees’ hive full of ripe honey. Instead of rewarding the bird with a share of the honey, he chases it away. The next time the young man tries to find honey, the bird gets his revenge!

title: Mwanamme na Mwanamke wa Kwanza
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Bunty na Bubbly
author: /author/sorit-gupto
summary: Bunty does not like soap, so she refuses to clean up. One night she has a dream. What happens after that?

title: Demane na Demazane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Sniffles Mamba na Punch Kipepeo
author: /author/herminder-ohri
summary: What are friends for, if not to help each other? Even friends like Sniffles, the Crocodile and Punch, the Butterfly. A lovely story about two clever friends.

title: Nyani walioenda huku na kule
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary:
People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots. They begin to look and behave like apes. The baboon families cannot live together anymore. 
The All Rights Reserved McCall Smith version is available here.

title: Msichana mwenye titi moja
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a man who lived happily with his wife. One day he took a walk into the forest. He met with a very beautiful girl. He immediately fell in love with her and wanted to marry her. However, she told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She therefore suggested to him to go and cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they would marry. So the man run as fast as he could to cut off his wife’s breast, and returned to the forest. But he did not find the beautiful girl to give her the breast. He was very perturbed. What happened to this man?

title: Sungura na Kobe (Tena!)
author: /author/venkatramana-gowda
/author/divaspathy-hegde
summary: Remember how the slow and steady tortoise beat the arrogant hare in that great race long ago? Now the two are back together again, and they have a task to complete. Each knows that he cannot do it without the other, but can these two big rivals work together?

title: Demane na Demazane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Mfalme wa Ndege
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Kato Mwakili na Shida Kubwa
author: /author/herminder-ohri
summary: Kato, the squirrel's family lived in a garden. One day, some people came there with machines to cut down the trees. How did Kato and his friends save themselves from this Big Trouble?

title: Vitu ninavyojua
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Different things that children are familiar with at home and in school.

title: Usiku ulivyoingia katika Kijiji cha kina Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Jua la Saba
author: /author/indian-folktale
summary: The Seventh Sun is a simple tale from a tribal community in Odisha, India. It is about a time when there were seven suns in the sky. Were the animals and human beings happy with so many suns? Find out for yourself in this story which teaches us to respect nature.

title: Watoto wa Nta
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Barua kwa mama
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A mother is going to hospital to give birth and her daughter writes her a letter.

title: Mfuko uzungumzao
author: /author/caroline-lentupuru
summary: Two little girls went out to collect firewood and met with a giant who pretended to need help with firewood. The giant was about to lie and take one of the little girls when the little girl identified herself.

title: Refiloe na kuku waliooshwa
author: /author/marion-drew
summary: Refiloe’s sister is getting married. It is the first wedding in the Tenane family. Refiloe’s chickens are very dirty and she decides to wash them for the wedding. The chickens do not like being washed. Refiloe cannot find her chickens when it is time for the wedding, but everyone is in for a big surprise.

title: Vayu, Upepo
author: /author/madhuri-pai
/author/rohini-nilekani
summary: This story describes all sorts of things the wind can do. Read more to find out what Vayu, the wind can do.

title: Nonkungu na Imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Wapi kigoe changu?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Niambie… sasa! Furaha na Huzuni
author: /author/madhav-chavan
summary: This story talks about what things make us happy and what makes us sad.

title: Mke Mti
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Jumamosi alasiri ya joto
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Nozibele na Nywele Tatu
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Nyanya na Msichana Aliyenuka
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A young girl’s grandmother makes her a beautiful makgabe. She goes to the river with her friends. They are jealous of her beautiful makgabe and trick her. She is eaten by a snake. The snake does not like the taste of the young girl’s makgabe, and it spits her out. Now she is all smelly. Who will look after her?

title: Sane in the market
author: /author/alice-kapolondo
summary: This a boy who went t to the market for the first time

title: Ufufuzi wa Furaha
author: /author/rebecca-njuguna
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Mvulana na Majitu
author: /author/james-elim
/author/joseph-opilo
summary: A boy disobeys his parents and goes to the forest. Guess what met him there!

title: Rafiki yangu Coco
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The writer was given a little puppy, Coco, as a present. The puppy grew together with its brother. When it was too old, the owner took away the brother.  Coco was sad until his brother was brought back.

title: Khayanga na Kibuyu chake
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Mti ulionusuru kijiji cha Ombalantu
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Mudhni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Khayanga na Kibuyu chake
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a little girl whose parents died. Her loss and pain lead her to seek comfort from her parents’ graves. She is miraculously given the gift of a special gourd, and through this gourd she experiences the presence of her parents.

title: Kisa Cha Mtoto Wa Tembo
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had short noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks. Baby elephant had questions about everything, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged the little elephant to go to the river and find out what the crocodile eats. While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: Anansi na Tai
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi is poor, but his friend Rabbit is a prosperous farmer. Anansi is jealous, and finds a way to take over his friend’s farm. He makes a lot of money selling Rabbit's fruit and vegetables. But one day on the way home from the market, something happens to change Anansi's fortunes again

title: Bweha mwenye njaa na zabibu chachu
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: A hungry jackal comes across an orchard where a ripe bunch of grapes is hanging from a branch. The jackal jumps up to grab the grapes but he falls hard on his back. He keeps jumping even higher and each time he falls even harder on his back. Will he ever get the grapes?

title: Mbuzi, Mbwa na Ng’ombe
author: /author/fabian-wakholi
summary: Goat, Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi, but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising. And as a result of what happened, each animal develops a different reaction to motor vehicles.

title: Mimi na familia yangu
author: /author/waako-joshua
/author/cornelius-gulere
summary: A story about a little boy’s adventures with a very unusual family!

title: Namukhaywa
author: /author/matthews-m-wanga
summary: Namukhaywa and her husband have 6 daughters, and he really wants a son. When she gives birth to a twin boy and girl she decides to hide her 7th daughter and only takes the son home to her husband. The twins grow up with separate lives, but one day they meet. Will they discover the truth?

title: Bweha na jua
author: /author/traditional-san-story
summary: Lazy Jackal falls in love with the sun and wants to take her home to meet his father. They set off on the journey with Jackal carrying the sun on his back, but they don’t get very far.

title: Shati la Hamisi la kijani kibichi
author: /author/adelheid-marie-bwire
summary: While shopping with his father for a school uniform Hamisi sees a boy wearing a an attractive green shirt. Will Hamisi be able to persuade his father to buy him the same shirt?
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Ng’ombe wetu
author: /author/ruth-odondi
summary: A story about a much loved family cow.
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Mwalimu Goso
author: /author/adapted-one-george-w-bateman%E2%80%99s-zanzibar-tales-versioned-mitugi-kamundi
authorDesc:
Adapted from one of George W Bateman’s Zanzibar Tales

Versioned by Mitugi Kamundi
summary: A teacher named Goso taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him. The children are very upset and want to find out who had killed their teacher.
copyrightHolder:
Adapted from one of George W Bateman’s Zanzibar Tales

Translated by Mitugi Kamundi

title: Adhabu
author: /author/adelheid-marie-bwire
summary: What is the punishment for a greedy boy who ate too much fruit?
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Matunda
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: There was a beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. In her family compound, there was a tree with delicious fruit. Her parents decided that their daughter would marry whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.  Who would overcame the test to win the girl's hand in marriage?

title: SIKU YANGU YA KWANZA SOKONI
author: /author/timothy-kabare
/author/ursula-nafula
summary: On Etabo’s sixth birthday, his mother and aunt take him to a faraway town to visit the market for the first time. At the market he has an adventure which eventually ends with a wonderful birthday present.

title: Panya
author: /author/nambi-sseppuuya-community-resource-centre
summary: Bush rat visits the house rat to see what a wonderful life he has living inside. But house rat's greed gets the better of him, and bush rat learns to value his own home.
copyrightHolder: Text: Ugandan Community Libraries Association (UgCLA) Artwork: African Storybook Initiative

title: Sungura chini ya mti
author: /author/phumy-zikode
summary: While Rabbit is sleeping under an apple tree, an apple falls to the ground. At the same time, Rabbit hears a voice shouting "Run rabbit run!" That's when the pandemonium starts!

title: Kijana Palinyang’
author: /author/gaspah-emukuru-juma
summary: An orphaned boy is a adopted by a rich villager. One day while Palinyang' and the other boys are out grazing cattle it starts to rain. The boys take shelter, and when the rain eventually stops the cattle have wandered away. Palingyang' goes in search of the animals - will he find them and his favourite cow?

title: Marafiki
author: /author/zimbili-dlamini
/author/hlengiwe-zondi
summary: A story about a boy and his friends, and the activities they like to do.
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Ninapenda kusoma
author: /author/letta-machoga
summary: This is a story about a little boy who loves to read stories. He loves it so much so that he wants to share a story with his family.
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Mwalimu wangu
author: /author/zimbili-dlamini
/author/hlengiwe-zondi
summary: This little girl loves her teacher, and wants to be just like her.
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Ng’ombe wa sokoni
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Story told through cows which happen to wonder off to the market.  They interrupt activities at the market and one woman takes it upon herself to complain and shout. Then the cows lash at the sellers.

title: Tazama wanyama
author: /author/jenny-katz
summary: Explore the sounds made by different farmyard animals. What noise does the farmer make?

title: Barua kwa mama
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A mother is going to hospital to give birth and her daughter writes her a letter.

title: Mkeka wa Akai wa kipekee
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost.

title: Ndovu na vyura
author: /author/mozambican-folktale
summary: How we must not upset the balance of nature.

title: Kwa nini Yayeri ni mashuhuri?
author: /author/michael-oguttu
summary: In this story we are presented with a child who seems to be perfect in every way. The reader is encouraged to think about which characteristics and actions make a person great.  Is Yayeri great?
copyrightHolder: Text: Uganda Community Libraries Association (UgCLA)  Artwork: African Storybook Initiative

title: Mumbi
author: /author/oloosirkon-ecd
summary: Bilingual story describing various activities that a little girl is engaged in

title: Usiku ulivyoingia katika Kijiji cha kina Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: There is no night time in Opio's village. One day he goes hunting and arrives at a place he doesn't know. When night falls there, Opio thinks he has gone blind. Then he discovers the truth and likes night so much that he takes it to his own village.

title: Fisi na kunguru
author: /author/ann-nduku
summary: Hyena wants to know what the white mark is at the back of Raven’s neck. On hearing that it is meat, he also wants to be able to fly into the clouds to get this 'meat'. He succeeds in flying, but it doesn't last and he falls to earth.

title: Jinsi Siafu alimwokoa Njiwa
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
/author/judith-baker
summary: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away. Dove saves Little Ant’s life. How does Little Ant thank Dove?

title: Kima ala mkia wake
author: /author/mozambican-folktale
summary: That rabbit is at it again!

title: Sababu Chura kuwa na Sura Mbaya
author: /author/mozambican-folktale
summary: Frog might have been as beautiful as Lizard if he would only listen!

title: Teksi ya Nanu
author: /author/marion-drew
summary: Nanu and her mother are waiting for a taxi to take them home. Nanu sees all sorts of interesting people and things while they wait. But will their taxi ever arrive?

title: Paka mwerevu
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Mister Kiio has a clever cat called Safi.

title: Rafiki ninaye mkosa
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Two young childhood friends grow up together in the village. One drops out of school and the other goes on lonely and missing her friend.

title: Mbegu Ndogo: Hadithi kumhusu Wangari Maathai
author: /author/nicola-rijsdijk
summary: In a village on the slopes of Mount Kenya, a little girl worked in the fields with her mother.  She worried as she saw the big forests disappearing, but she knew the power of a tiny seed.
copyrightHolder: Nicola Rijsdijk, Maya Marshak, Tarryn-Anne Anderson, Bookdash.org and African Storybook Initiative, 2015

title: My family
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: My family likes to read. Find out what each person is reading.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: Ekale koosi
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story is about the different sorts of books my family reads.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Musyi wakwa
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story is about the different sorts of books my family reads.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Ifamili  yanje
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story is about the different sorts of books my family reads.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Be muungo mweefwe
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story is about the different sorts of books my family reads.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Lị́cọ́ ãmadrị̂
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: My family likes to read. Find out what each person is reading.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: Lelapa la me
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story is about the different sorts of books my family reads.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Amannyo
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: In this story we look at the different kinds of teeth animals have and what happens to our teeth when we start to grow up.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: My body
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: We can do many actions with our bodies, but there's one activity that we can't do.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: Mwii wakwa
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This story describes what we can do with our bodies. Read more to see what we cannot do with our bodies.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Umzimba wam
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: We can do many actions with our bodies, but there's one activity that we can't do.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: AKAKUWAN
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: We can do many actions with our bodies, but there's one activity that we can't do.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: Mmele waka
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: We can do many actions with our bodies, but there's one activity that we can't do.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007

title: Ma eco `di `ye ra
author: /author/clare-verbeek
/author/thembani-dladla
/author/zanele-buthelezi
summary: This picture book describes activities that we learn to do as we grow up.
copyrightHolder: School of Education and Development (Centre for Adult Education), University of KwaZulu-Natal, 2007.

title: Nonike ou
author: /author/clare-verbeek
