title: Joy agenda ku somero
author: /author/augustine-napagi
summary: Joy is going to school.

title: Emirimu abantu gyebakola mu kyaalo kyewaffe.
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: Here we can all get to know about activities done in most communities.

title: Nakitto at school.
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: This lovely story attracts and encourages parents and children who wish to start school.

title: Anansi eyaleetera abantu  engelo
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Long ago, the sky god kept all stories locked up in a wooden box. People asked clever Anansi to ask the sky god for the stories. The sky god agreed, but only if Anansi performed three seemingly impossible tasks.

title: Anansi, Enkwale ne Waggoonya
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Nakkungu Nakintu N’ekikule kule
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Anansi ne Wanfudu
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Mulongo n’Empisi
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Wankoko ne Wakamunye
author: /author/ann-nduku
summary: Hen borrows  a needle from Eagle and loses it. As revenge, Eagle always snatches Hen’s chicks whenever an opportunity arises because of the needle.

title: Engeri ekiro gye kyajja ku kyalo kya Kajoba
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Nanziri n’endeku
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Abaana abaava mu nvumbo
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks outside. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to help their brother.

title: Olunaku lwe nasooka okugenda mu katale
author: /author/timothy-kabare
/author/ursula-nafula
summary: On Etabo’s sixth birth day, he is taken by his mother and aunt to the market far away from home for the first time.  He gets lost and when he is reunited with his mother and aunt, he receives his birth day present.

title: Nakkungu n’ekikulekule
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Mwami  Nsowera ne Mwami Bontwe
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: Mr Fly and Mr Big Head were friends. Then one day they argued about who could cross the river. Mr Big Head sank into the water. Mr Fly laughed so much that his mouth became wider and wider…

title: Eŋŋaaŋa
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo-christopher
summary: Young boys like going out into forests to hunt for birds. They use catapults for hunting birds.  This is a story about a young boy who found and shot a Hornbill as he was walking through the village. A Hornbill is commonly found in forests in tropical Africa. He was very excited and offered the bird to an old man in the village who liked eating anything given to him.

title: Wuliliza omubiri gwange
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Omusomesa Bbosa
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher.

title: Nakku n’enviiri essatu
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Enkyukakyuka ey'essanyu
author: /author/ssebukyu-robert
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Langi eya kiragala
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: This story is about the colour green, and green things that are valuable to us.

title: Akatti kange kaliwa?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Ewammwe waliyo ki?
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: This story shows and teaches home objects,and talks about how relatives are  helpful  by supporting the family.

title: Kabali ataasa kitaawe
author: /author/kanyiva-sandi
summary: Musau’s father, Syonzola, was used to getting drunk almost every night and would pretend that he was being attacked. When villagers would come, they would find that it was only a joke.  One night, however, he was actually attacked by a hyena and was saved by his son Musau.

title: Ebire
author: /author/clark-ness
summary: What clouds bring to the environment?

title: Maama anyuma
author: /author/martha-nansamba
summary: Mother is sweet and hardworking.She has love for all her children.

title: Amazzi bw'ebulamu
author: /author/martha-nansamba
summary: Water is Life.

title: Erinnya lyange nze ani?
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: It is a brain storming game.Think critically to find some one`s name after reading about him or her.

title: Jjaja omukyala eyali ow’ekisa eri omuwala awunya
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A young girl’s grandmother makes her a beautiful makgabe. Her friends are jealous and trick her because they want the makgabe. Then the girl is eaten by a snake. Fortunately her grandmother saves the day.

title: Omuti ogwataasa abantu b’Embuya
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Mudhni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Omuwala ow’ebbeere erimu
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: One day a man met a beautiful woman in the forest. Although he was married he immediately fell in love with the woman and wanted to marry her. She told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She asks him to cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they will marry.

title: Akatti kange kaliwa?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Ebigaya ebyali byetala eno n’eri
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots, and they begin to look and behave like apes. Then these baboon families find that they no longer want to live together.

title: Abaana baagala okuzannya
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: Children enjoy playing different games according to age. Read the story and find your favourite games and share with friends.

title: Embwa
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
summary: The story is about a man who had his own dog which was very faithful and obedient to him.

title: Omulenzi eyazannya.
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: Joe was sent for sugar and bread but he was attracted by different things which led him to loose the money for shopping.

title: Enva z'ebinyebwa
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
summary: The story is about the mother who was preparing  groundnut soup for her family. The whole family enjoyed the soup.

title: Jjajja wange.
author: /author/augustine-napagi
summary: A boy visits her grandma and get some fun.

title: Ensujju
author: /author/cissy-namugerwa
summary: The poem describes the values of a pumpkin.

title: Omukeeka gwa Nakaayi ogwenjawulo
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost in the hills.

title: Engeri Enkuyege bwe yataasa Ejjuba.
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
/author/judith-baker
summary: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away. Dove saves Little Ant’s life. How does Little Ant thank Dove?

title: Omwana gwe Njovu ogujagu jagu.
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had short noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks. Baby elephant had questions about everything, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged the little elephant to go to the river and find out what the crocodile eats. While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: Nyumirwa
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A bilingual text in English and Kiswahili, about all the things a young girl enjoys doing.

title: Omusajja eya beeranga yekka.
author: /author/carlos-kanembera
summary: This is the story of a man who didn't want to live near other people. The man and his wife moved to a remote house, far away from everyone. This isolation has terrible consequences.

title: Nze n’abenŋanda zange
author: /author/waako-joshua
/author/cornelius-gulere
summary: A story about a little boy’s adventures with a very unusual family!

title: Lwaki Envubu tezirina bwoya
author: /author/basilio-gimo
/author/david-ker
summary: Hares are popular creatures in African folktales. They are famous for behaving badly and always getting away with it. In this Nyungwe folktale, we see what happens when Hare refuses to forgive Hippo for stepping on his foot.

title: Namukwaya
author: /author/matthews-m-wanga
summary: Namukhaywa and her husband have 6 daughters, and he really wants a son. When she gives birth to a twin boy and girl she decides to hide her 7th daughter and only takes the son home to her husband. The twins grow up with separate lives, but one day they meet. Will they discover the truth?

title: Tingi n’ente
author: /author/ingrid-schechter
summary: Grandmother saves Tingi's life.

title: Omukazi eyava mu muti
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Okusoma kunyuma
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
summary: The rhyme talks about the goodness of learning though the road to success is bitter but the fruits are sweet.

title: Omukyala owobuvunanyizibwa
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
/author/milly-kasule
summary: The story talks about how a pregnant mother takes care of herself.

title: Okunoonya amazzi
author: /author/augustine-napagi
summary: This book is about a frog looking for cold water.

title: Omuliro.
author: /author/cissy-namugerwa
summary: The story talks about the dangers of playing with fire in children and even adults.

title: Nana ne Lavi
author: /author/andries-du-plessis
summary: This story teaches every body to take care of young babies.All parents should not leave babies with children at home.

title: Ente za muliraanwa.
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: This story teaches how farmers should take care of their animals so that they don't go to other people`s gardens to destroy crops.

title: Wambuzi, Wambwa ne Wante
author: /author/fabian-wakholi
summary: Goat, Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi, but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising. And as a result of what happened, each animal develops a different reaction to motor vehicles.

title: Ekiseera ky'oluwumula
author: /author/nansamba-martha
summary: This story talks about  how the Holiday is interesting.

title: Ennukuta yange eya Aa.
author: /author/cissy-namugerwa
/author/ritah-katetemera
summary: The rhyme talks about letter Aa.

title: Obuyonjo bulungi
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: Cleanliness is very important in every one`s daily life and it protects us from many deseases.

title: Omukazi eyawona okumiribwa.
author: /author/ritah-katetemera
/author/cissy-namugerwa
summary: The story talks about a woman who escaped from being swallowed by a python.

title: Wanfuddu omukadde
author: /author/cissy-namugerwa
summary: The story talks about the old tortoise which lived with his two children.Ntonio and Bbaale.

title: Emmondo erumwa enjala n’ensaali ezikaawa
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: A hungry jackal comes across an orchard where a ripe bunch of grapes is hanging from a branch. The jackal jumps up to grab the grapes but he falls hard on his back. He keeps jumping even higher and each time he falls even harder on his back. Will he ever get the grapes?

title: Okuzannya akapiira
author: /author/letta-machoga
summary: This is a story about a group of young people who enjoy playing soccer. Their coach has a big surprise for the team!
copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Lwaki wakikere mubi nnyo?
author: /author/mozambican-folktale
summary: Frog might have been as beautiful as Lizard if he would only listen!

title: Ggonya omuyala.
author: /author/christian-g
summary: The hungry crocodile looks for food

title: Okubba.
author: /author/deborah
summary: stealing is bad

title: Jajja wange omukyala.
author: /author/augustine-napagi
summary: A boy visits her grandma and get some fun.

title: Omuwala Norah
author: /author/annet-ssebaggala
summary: Norah loves her doll and is worried one day when she thinks the doll is lost.

title: Why hippos have no hair
author: /author/basilio-gimo
/author/david-ker
summary: Hares are popular creatures in African folktales. They are famous for behaving badly and always getting away with it. In this Nyungwe folktale, we see what happens when Hare refuses to forgive Hippo for stepping on his foot.

title: Uxamwali bwa Kolo na Nyakhoko
author: /author/basilio-gimo
summary: Things are fine for good friends Crocodile and Baboon, until Crocodile gets sick. It seems that Baboon must make the ultimate sacrifice if he wants his friend to recover.

title: Inyobo eyinakit imiriai emameete kede ka ajul?
author: /author/basilio-gimo
/author/david-ker
summary: Hares are popular creatures in African folktales. They are famous for behaving badly and always getting away with it. In this Nyungwe folktale, we see what happens when Hare refuses to forgive Hippo for stepping on his foot.

title: Cikondweso kudzulu
author: /author/basilio-gimo
summary: This tale explains why pigs have flat noses. What else does the story teach us?

title: No pigs allowed

title: Niichi ka Niapolon
author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: This a story about little and big things.
copyrightHolder: Vian Oelofsen, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Kenda khuche
author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: Sentences about things with can do with your eyes, nose, mouth and hands.
copyrightHolder: Thembinkosi Kohli, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Kapana!
author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: Sentences about things with can do with your eyes, nose, mouth and hands.
copyrightHolder: Thembinkosi Kohli, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: Sentences about things with can do with your eyes, nose, mouth and hands.

title: Khutsie!
author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: Sentences about things with can do with your eyes, nose, mouth and hands.
copyrightHolder: Thembinkosi Kohli, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Asambe
author: /author/carole-bloch
summary: Sentences about what we experience with our senses--smell, taste, see and touch.
copyrightHolder: Thembinkosi Kohli, Carole Bloch and PRAESA, 2002

title: Children of wax
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks outside. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to help their brother.

title: First man and first woman
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about the beginning of the world and the first humans. They rise as snakes from the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour. As they move up to the surface the snakes change their form to start new lives.

title: Abaana bomu bulimbo
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three children who were made of wax. They have to do everything at night for fear of melting in the sun, but one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight. One day he walks out in the sun and starts to melt. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Nkhono le ngoanana ea nkhang
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A young girl’s grandmother makes her a beautiful makgabe. Her friends are jealous and trick her because they want the makgabe. Then the girl is eaten by a snake. Fortunately her grandmother saves the day.

title: Omosacha omotang’ani
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Mũndũũme wa Mbee
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Omusatsa wa Mbeli Omukhasi wa Mbeli
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Ekile Lo eking’aren ka Aberu na eking’aren
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Indoda yokuqala nomfazi wokuqala
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Olée le dukúya
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Umusaani umukiboole, Umukhasi umukiboole
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: ágúpí òkò rɨ̀ pɨ òkʉ́ òkò rɨ̀ be
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about the beginning of the world and the first humans. They rise as snakes from the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour. As they move up to the surface the snakes change their form to start new lives.

title: Enkolóng e Naápishana
author: /author/indian-folktale
summary: The Seventh Sun is a simple tale from a tribal community in Odisha, India. It is about a time when there were seven suns in the sky. Were the animals and human beings happy with so many suns? Find out for yourself in this story which teaches us to respect nature.

title: Nonkungu o Imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Anansi ó Olóíkúmá
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Anansi ó Eng'énó
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Anansi, ilkúrruki ó ilkinosîn
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Inkéra é emánóó
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Ilmaisurîn le kokoô
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The little girl is curious as she watches her grandma preparing to ripen bananas.  Where grandma stores the bananas to ripen remains top secret to the disappointment of her grandchild. But how long does it take before the grandchild discovers grandma’s secret?

title: Kóreê ésíarê áí naaríéki empíra?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Oláíténg'énani ojî Goso
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher. They went around and asked everyone in the neighbourhood they suspected could be the culprit. Read the story to find out who killed Goso!

title: Eneikunúnye enkéwarie emurúa e Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Olojong'áni ó Elúkúnyá Sápuk
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: Mr. Fly and Mr. Big head were two great friends. Then one day they argued about who could swim across the river.  They decided to go out and swim to prove who was right.  Mr. Big Head failed to swim. Mr. Fly laughed so much that his mouth became wider and wider…

title: Olmódáí ojî Kisirusiru
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: Once upon a time, there was a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. One day he annoyed his father so much that he could not tolerate him any longer. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. They walked for very long as they looked for a place where they could set up their new home. By night time, they were tired and they decided to climb up a tree and sleep there till morning. However, as they were settling in, they heard some noise down below. They became so frightened when they looked down and saw some fierce men that they let their door fall. The men had lots of goods with them. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Empíúnotó é enchipái
author: /author/rebecca-njuguna
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Intokitín Náyíólo
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Different things that children are familiar with at home and in school.

title: Tólikíoki tenákatá - Enchipái ó Enkisinánuo
author: /author/madhav-chavan
summary: This story talks about what things make us happy and what makes us sad.

title: Aininíng osésen láí
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Enkóp áng é enking'asíá
author: /author/herminder-ohri
summary: God created all kinds of animals and birds. Then he created man who was to be the keeper of the earth. The animals and birds protested so what did God say? Find out in Our Wonderful World.

title: Olbéné oiró
author: /author/caroline-lentupuru
summary: Two little girls went out to collect firewood and met with a giant who pretended to need help with firewood. The giant was about to lie and take one of the little girls when the little girl identified herself.

title: Kayánga ó Emókór enyé
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Enkolóng e Jumamósi nairówua
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Nozibele ó ilpápít okúni
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Entíto naáta olkína obô
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a man who lived happily with his wife. One day he met a very beautiful girl in the forest. He immediately fell in love with her and wanted to marry her. However, she told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She asked him to go and cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they would marry. What does the man do?

title: Olchoré láí ojî Coco
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The writer was given a little puppy, Coco, as a present. The puppy grew together with its brother. When it was too old, the owner took away the brother.  Coco was sad until his brother was brought back.

title: Olkínkí le oó Imotónyi
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Olchaní óítajeúó iltúng'áná lé Ombalantu
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Mudhni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Esôs é Akai
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost in the hills.

title: Eneikuná enkálaóni peê eitajéu entúrkulúo
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
/author/judith-baker
summary: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away. Dove saves Little Ant’s life. How does Little Ant thank Dove?

title: Enkíné, Oldía ó Enkíténg
author: /author/fabian-wakholi
summary: Goat, Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi, but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising. And as a result of what happened, each animal develops a different reaction to motor vehicles.

title: Olkúoo lé oltómé oikilikúánisho
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had short noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks. Baby elephant had questions about everything, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged the little elephant to go to the river and find out what the crocodile eats. While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: Káshípákíno
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A bilingual text in English and Maa, about all the things a young girl enjoys doing.

title: Olmáréí láí o Nánu
author: /author/waako-joshua
/author/cornelius-gulere
summary: A story about a little boy’s adventures with a very unusual family!

title: Namukhaywa
author: /author/matthews-m-wanga
summary: Namukhaywa and her husband have 6 daughters, and he really wants a son. When she gives birth to a twin boy and girl she decides to hide her 7th daughter and only takes the son home to her husband. The twins grow up with separate lives, but one day they meet. Will they discover the truth?

title: Anansi o Loikuma
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Anansi we Ng’eno
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Entito orkina Obo
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: One day a man met a beautiful woman in the forest. Although he was married he immediately fell in love with the woman and wanted to marry her. She told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She asks him to cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they will marry.

title: Eneikununye apa enkewarie emurua  e Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: There is no night time in Opio's village. One day he goes hunting and arrives at a place he doesn't know. When night falls there, Opio thinks he has gone blind. Then he discovers the truth and likes night so much that he takes it to his own village.

title: Orkingi loo Motonyi
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a tiny bird tricks him. Do the birds get their king?

title: Anansi, Irkurruki Orkinosin
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Nkera emanoo
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks outside. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to help their brother.

title: Oltung’áni óbîk ópeny
author: /author/carlos-kanembera
summary: This is the story of a man who didn't want to live near other people. The man and his wife moved to a remote house, far away from everyone. This isolation has terrible consequences.

title: Enkitók Naguatúno
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Olukusi
author: /author/reviva-schermbrucker
summary: This book consists of descriptive sentences with photographs of everyday brown objects.
copyrightHolder: Reviva Schermbrucker, Sue Kramer and PRAESA, 2002

title: Nonkungu ne Imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Eshialo shiefu shiokhuchamisia
author: /author/herminder-ohri
summary: God created all kinds of animals and birds. Then he created man who was to be the keeper of the earth. The animals and birds protested so what did God say? Find out in Our Wonderful World.

title: Anansi nende Obuchesi
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Anansi, Amakhokho nende Tsikwena
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Kisirusiru, we Eshiyingwa
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was once a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. As they looked for a place to set up their new home, they encountered some thieves who had a lot of stolen money and some household goods. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Anansi ne Likhutu
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Mukhwana nende Mulongo
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Were wa Musafu
author: /author/indian-folktale
summary: The Seventh Sun is a simple tale from a tribal community in Odisha, India. It is about a time when there were seven suns in the sky. Were the animals and human beings happy with so many suns? Find out for yourself in this story which teaches us to respect nature.

title: Mukhwana nende Mulongo
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Omwami wa Amayoni
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Efindu fia ndamanya
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: Different things that children are familiar with at home and in school.

title: Omukhasi Musala
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: This is the story of an old man who has everything he wants – except a wife. So he decides to carve one for himself, out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man. So they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Mwichuma ndala mushiteere  shiomubasu omululu
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to their skirts and shirts? How would they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Mwami Isi nende Mwami Wokurwe Kukhoongo
author: /author/dorothy-fetaru
summary: Mr. Fly and Mr. Big head were two great friends. Then one day they argued about who could swim across the river.  They decided to go out and swim to prove who was right.  Mr. Big Head failed to swim. Mr. Fly laughed so much that his mouth became wider and wider…

title: Prisca nende Obushinga Butaru
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Okhukalukhana Okhuyiakha
author: /author/catherine-were
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: Namukhaywa
author: /author/matthews-m-wanga
summary: Story of a man whose wife bore him girls only threatens that if she gave birth to another girl he would kill her but would throw a party for her if she bore him a son. The wife goes to the mid-wife and gives birth to twin. Find out what she did next.

title: Omwitsa wanje Kulukulu
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The writer was given a little puppy, Coco, as a present. The puppy grew together with its brother. When it was too old, the owner took away the brother.  Coco was sad until his brother was brought back.

title: Omusaala Kwaonia litala lia Namulungu(Ombalantu)
author: /author/karen-von-wiese
/author/beryl-salt
/author/muhdni-grimwood
/author/barbara-meyerowitz
summary: Thaimi and her brother Angula have a favourite baobab tree that they like to visit. One day raiders come to the village and Thaimi has a clever plan to hide everyone and save them. Can a tree really save a village?
copyrightHolder: Karen von Wiese, Beryl Salt, Mudhni Grimwood, Barbara Meyerowitz, 1988

title: Omusatsa wa Mbeli Omukhasi wa Mbeli
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A story about how people came into being and populated the earth. They rise in snake like form from  the depths of a dark cold pool into a sunlit world of colour, undergoing the changes that are needed to live in their  new world.

title: Liyambo lilobole lia Akai
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost in the hills.

title: Ngala Liche liaonia Liusiu
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
/author/judith-baker
summary: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away. Dove saves Little Ant’s life. How does Little Ant thank Dove?

title: Omwana we inzofu, mwangu omuchesi
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had short noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks. Baby elephant had questions about everything, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged the little elephant to go to the river and find out what the crocodile eats. While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: Imbusi, Imbwa nende Ing’ombe
author: /author/fabian-wakholi
summary: Goat, Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi, but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising. And as a result of what happened, each animal develops a different reaction to motor vehicles.

title: Lisimba lieinzala nende tsinduli tsindulu
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: A hungry jackal comes across an orchard where a ripe bunch of grapes is hanging from a branch. The jackal jumps up to grab the grapes but he falls hard on his back. He keeps jumping even higher and each time he falls even harder on his back. Will he ever get the grapes?

title: Ndachama
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: A bilingual text in English and Kiswahili, about all the things a young girl enjoys doing.

title: Omusatsa wamenya yenyene
author: /author/carlos-kanembera
summary: This is the story of a man who didn't want to live near other people. The man and his wife moved to a remote house, far away from everyone. This isolation has terrible consequences.

title: Oluyia lwanje nende esie
author: /author/waako-joshua
/author/cornelius-gulere
summary: A story about a little boy’s adventures with a very unusual family!

title: Anansi nende Obuchesi
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Amaremwa ka Kukhu
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The little girl is curious as she watches her grandma preparing to ripen bananas.  Where grandma stores the bananas to ripen remains top secret to the disappointment of her grandchild. But how long does it take before the grandchild discovers grandma’s secret?

title: Shinga eshiro shietsa mulukoba lwa Opio
author: /author/robert-ekuka
summary: Opio comes from a family of hunters. On his first day of the hunting experience, his dogs stray and on following them, Opio arrives at a stranger village.  When night falls, Opio thinks his host fed him on something very bad that caused him to lose sight. He learns that it was night. He likes night so much that he brings it to his own village.

title: Wamachina  nakhamuka khe
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Abaana be iula
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks outside. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to help their brother.

title: Iloloti Ilomalomanga
author: /author/caroline-lentupuru
summary: Two little girls went out to collect firewood and met with a giant who pretended to need help with firewood. The giant was about to lie and take one of the little girls when the little girl identified herself.

title: Nonkungu ne Imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Amaremwa ka Kukhu
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The little girl is curious as she watches her grandma preparing to ripen bananas.  Where grandma stores the bananas to ripen remains top secret to the disappointment of her grandchild. But how long does it take before the grandchild discovers grandma’s secret?

title: Akhapao khanje khali yena?
author: /author/meera-tendolkar
/author/madhav-chavan
summary: A boy is looking everywhere for his cricket bat. Can you help him find it?

title: Curious baby elephant
author: /author/judith-baker
/author/lorato-trok
summary: Elephants once had short noses, but thanks to a curious baby elephant, they ended up with useful long trunks. Baby elephant had questions about everything, including what the crocodile has for dinner. Crow urged the little elephant to go to the river and find out what the crocodile eats. While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: Tselane le Limo
author: /author/lorato-trok
summary: This is a folktale about a little girl called Tselane who is very fond of her childhood village. After the passing of her father, Tselane’s mother wanted them to move to another village to start a new life. Tselane wanted to hear none of it and her mother relented and let her stay on her own while she moved to another village. They made a pact that she will bring Tselane food daily but she must keep the door locked at all times to keep the marauding giants at bay, the only way Tselane should open the door is when she hears her sing her signature song. Somehow the giant did find out that Tselane stayed on her own and he worked on a plan to get into the house and take her to his cave. Will the giant succeed in his plan?

title: Tselane le Dimo
author: /author/lorato-trok
summary: This is a folktale about a little girl called Tselane who is very fond of her childhood village. After the passing of her father, Tselane’s mother wanted them to move to another village to start a new life. Tselane wanted to hear none of it and her mother relented and let her stay on her own while she moved to another village. They made a pact that she will bring Tselane food daily but she must keep the door locked at all times to keep the marauding giants at bay, the only way Tselane should open the door is when she hears her sing her signature song. Somehow the giant did find out that Tselane stayed on her own and he worked on a plan to get into the house and take her to his cave. Will the giant succeed in his plan?

title: Tselane and the giant
author: /author/lorato-trok
summary: After Tselane’s father died her mother wanted them to move to another village to start a new life. But Tselane didn't want to go, and her mother agreed to let her stay on her own. They made a pact that Tselane would only open the door when she heard her mother sing. Meanwhile a giant is listening to their conversation and plans to catch Tselane.

title: Itaok a Etom nikachwaan

While there, curious baby elephant discovers the answer and more.

title: The Moon and the Cap
author: /author/noni
summary: A little boy gets a blue cap from his mother. The wind blows the cap into a big tree and boy is very sad. At night someone surprising wears the cap, but the boy doesn't mind. Will he get his cap back?

title: Ce-beeriizo ga sootiya gumo

title: Lalela umzimba wami
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Kiira akwaan kang
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Inyanga nekepisi
author: /author/noni
summary: Do you like to wear a cap on a sunny day? Find out who else wears a cap in this story.

title: Khoeli le kepisi
author: /author/noni
summary: Do you like to wear a cap on a sunny day? Find out who else wears a cap in this story.

title: Inyanga ne Kepusi
author: /author/noni
summary: Do you like to wear a cap on a sunny day? Find out who else wears a cap in this story.

title: Abantwana abenziwe ngamakhandlela
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was they were made of wax, and so they had to do everything at night for fear of melting in the hot sun. But one of the boys longs to see the world in the daylight and he walks out into the sun to see the birds and trees. Of course, he melts in the heat of the sun. His brothers are heartbroken, but they make a plan to save their brother.

title: Syana sya Mũvũa
author: /author/southern-african-folktale

summary: The animals in the jungle rush to the new school with great enthusiasm. What do you think happened after that?

title: Isikolo sasehlathini
author: /author/madhav-chavan
/author/meera-tendolkar
summary: The animals in the jungle rush to the new school with great enthusiasm. But they are not enthusiastic when they see who their new teacher is.

title: The baboons that went this way and that
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary:
People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots. They begin to look and behave like apes. The baboon families cannot live together anymore. 
The All Rights Reserved McCall Smith version is available here.

title: The baboons that went this way and that
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: People in a small village moved to the hills to escape wild animals. They learn to survive on fruit and roots, and they begin to look and behave like apes. Then these baboon families find that they no longer want to live together.

copyrightHolder: African Storybook Initiative and Molteno Institute, 2014

title: Pula

title: Demane le Demazane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Morutiši Goso
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher.

title: Nozibele le Meriri e Meraro
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Mokotla wa go bolela
author: /author/caroline-lentupuru
summary: Three little girls meet a giant who pretends to need help with firewood. The giant begins leading one the girls away, when a man stops them both and asks what the child's name is. What will happen to the little girl?

title: Koko le mosetsana wa go nkga
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: A young girl’s grandmother makes her a beautiful makgabe. Her friends are jealous and trick her because they want the makgabe. Then the girl is eaten by a snake. Fortunately her grandmother saves the day.

title: Mosadi wa sehlare
author: /author/southern-african-folktale
summary: An old man has everything he wants – except a wife. So he carves one for himself out of a tree.  Some young men from a neighbouring village decide she is too beautiful for an old man and they steal her. He is grief-stricken, and tries everything to get her back.

title: Mosimane wa megabaru
author: /author/tukei-cathy
summary: This story is suitable for young readers

title: Mmetse wa Akai wa bohlokwa
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat. Akai’s mat protects her from harm and, with the help of a little bird, helps her to find her way home after she gets lost in the hills.

title: O dira eng?
author: /author/nina-orange
summary: Short sentences using simple present tense verbs.

title: Ngwana wa sejato!
author: /author/sara-mohale
summary: This story is about a greedy girl who ends up in tears after over eating.

title: Demane and Demazane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are mistreated by their uncle and run away to live in a cave. They have heard that cannibals live in the hills near their cave, so the children have to very careful. While Demane goes out to look for food Demazane stays in the cave, with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell. Will Demazane listen to her brother?

title: King of birds
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a tiny bird tricks him. Do the birds get their king?

title: Umuyiinga we Binywiinywi
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Ndemane na Ndemanzane
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: Orphans Demane and Demazane are left to fend for themselves. After being mistreated by their uncle, they ran away to live in a cave. They were scared as they heard that cannibals lived in the nearby hills. Demane went out to look for food while Demazane stayed in the cave. Demane left her with strict instructions not to cook meat as cannibals are attracted by the smell of cooking meat. Will Demazane listen to her brother? Read on to find out what happened to Demane and Demazane!

title: Nozibele and the three hairs
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three girls are gathering wood on a hot day. They decide to go swimming and by the time they are finished it's late and they must rush home. On the way Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind and she goes back on her own. Her journey takes a dramatic turn from there on.

title: One hot Saturday afternoon
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three children go to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and start splashing in the water. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. How will they explain themselves to their mother?

title: Dancing
author: /author/mary-nabire
/author/tessa-welch
summary: A poem about a girl who loves to dance. Her teacher finds this irritating, but her mother encourages her talent.

title: Mokibelo wa go fiša tšhiritšhiri
author: /author/nombulelo-thabane
/author/tessa-welch
summary: On a very hot Saturday afternoon, three girls go off to play next to the river. Even though they are not allowed to swim, they soon strip and spend the afternoon splashing and having fun. When they want to go home again, they can’t find their clothes. What could have happened to them? How will they explain themselves to their parents?

title: Nonzimbele na Nzwĩĩ Itatũ
author: /author/tessa-welch
summary: Three young girls go to the forest to gather some wood on a hot day. There was enough, so they thought, and they can swim until it got cooler after gathering the wood. By the time they finished swimming, it was already late and they had to rush back home. Further away, Nozibele realises that she has left her beads behind. She goes back on her own after her friends refuses to go back with her. Nozibele’s journey takes a dramatic turn from there on. Read on to find out what happens to Nozibele.

title: Mashilo le Mashilwane
author: /author/bathokwa-book-club
summary: Mashilo and Mashilwane were brothers. Mashilo became jealous when their father gave his little brother more cattle. Mashilwane wass kind and got a price for his kindness.

title: A naughty girl
author: /author/bathokwa-book-club
summary: A story about a little girl who never listens to her mother and learned a great lesson

author: /author/moeketsi-buku
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. Have you ever listened to what your body tells you?

title: Antoni ke bo mang bale
author: /author/traditional-song
summary: Antoni, ke bo mang bale is a traditional African song sung during a game of skipping rope. It is known and used cross-culturally in South Africa and is also sung in multiple languages.
copyrightHolder: Meyerowitz B, Copans J, and Welch T, 1988

title: Ts'epang le Katse ea lehata
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Mulongo and the hyenas
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: Mulongo went into the forest to meet her friends. She took the wrong turn and got lost. Mulongo walked until she was tired, and fell asleep under a tree. She woke  when it was dark, and hyenas were gathering around her. How will she get home safely?

title: Mulongo ni Namuunyu
author: /author/sarah-nangobi
summary: This is a story of a young girl, Mulongo who went into the forest to meet her friends. However, she failed to find the path her friends had used. She took the wrong turn. She walked for a long distance but did not find her friends. Exhausted, she sat down under a tree, and soon fell asleep. She woke up when it was already dark. She was scared especially when she saw the lions that had surrounded her. Mulongo, who was to be eaten by the lions, managed to escape. Find out how she survived being eaten by the lions.

title: Anansi ka Akumaach
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Anansi doesn't want to share his delicious yams with his friend, Turtle, and tricks him out of getting any. So when Turtle invites Anansi to dinner in his watery home, Turtle makes sure that Anansi doesn't enjoy any of his food either.

title: Maru
author: /author/clark-ness

title: Motshelanosi
author: /author/carlos-kanembera
summary: This is the story of a man who didn't want to live near other people. The man and his wife moved to a remote house, far away from everyone. This isolation has terrible consequences.

title: Moipone le Sego sa gagwe
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

title: Nonkungu and the imbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu was going to visit her uncle and her mother gave her a beautiful beaded skirt to wear. On the way to her uncle's village, Nonkungu meets a girl who asks to try on the lovely skirt. When they exchange clothes Nonkungu sees the girl's tail and realises that she is really an imbulu!

title: Nokungu N’eimbulu
author: /author/alan-kenyon
/author/viv-kenyon
summary: Nonkungu is sent to her rich uncle who lives in another village by her parents. She's very excited and she's got on a beautiful beaded dress made by her mother. On her way to her uncle's village, she meets a young girl across the stream who also claims to be uncle Mtonyama's niece and is also coincidentally visiting him. She complements Nonkungu on her beautiful beaded dress and asks if she can try it on. Nonkungu agrees and when they exchange clothes she then realises that the girl is really an imbulu. She is frightened. Do you think Nonkungu's journey will be smooth? What will happen to the imbulu? Read on to find out what happens in this exciting tale!

title: Ngewa ya Kayanga na Kĩkuu Kyake
author: /author/ursula-nafula
summary: The story tells of Khayanga, a 10 year old girl who is taken in by a distant, poor and frail relative after the death of her parents.  Her loss and pain lead her to seek guidance and comfort from her parents’ graves.  As a sign that they are always with her, she is miraculously given the gift of a very special gourd and it becomes the source of comfort and good luck. Khayanga experiences the presence of her mother through songs and this special gourd.

summary: The story is about a man and his to goats which treasured so much and he never expected them to eat his  potatoes vine , he was suspicious about the neighbor's goats all time but the end he was so disappointed spearing his own goat thinking it is for the neighbor.

title: Liŋaasa (ŋaa, ŋaa)
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo-christopher
summary: Young boys like going out into forests to hunt for birds. They use catapults for hunting birds.  This is a story about a young boy who found and shot a Hornbill as he was walking through the village. A Hornbill is commonly found in forests in tropical Africa. He was very excited and offered the bird to an old man in the village who liked eating anything given to him.

title: Àràkílíkò
author: /author/bukheye-mulongo-christopher
summary: A young boy finds and shoots a Hornbill. He gives the dead bird to an old man in the village, who cooks and eats the Hornbill.

title: Anansi n’obong’aini
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: The sky god decides to  give Anansi the spider  a pot of wisdom. He is so excited by all he learns from looking into it that he wants to hide it in a tree so that he can keep it all to himself. Unfortunately for him (but fortunately for the people of the world), the pot falls and breaks.

title: Ananzi na ũĩ
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale

title: Anansi ka aosou
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Manaasi ni Kamakhula
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Mungu wa angani anaamua kumpa Buibui Anansi chungu cha hekima. Anasisimka sana kutoka na yale anajifunza kiasi cha kutaka kukificha chungu hicho mtini ili afaidike pekee yake.  Kwa bahati mbaya, (lakini bahati nzuri kwa walimwengu), chungu kinaanguka na kuvunjika.

title: Anansi, the crows, and the crocodiles
author: /author/ghanaian-folktale
summary: Greedy Anansi tries to trick his friends the crows into giving him more than his fair share of figs. The crows uncover his tricks and abandon him on an island. He tries to fly, but lands in the river among hungry crocodiles. This seems like the end for Anansi, will he find a way out?

title: Fruit
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: There was a beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. In her family compound, there was a tree with delicious fruit. Her parents decided that their daughter would marry whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.  Who would overcame the test to win the girl's hand in marriage?

title: Wafumba akatooke - You prepare bananas
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: A Lugwere children’s game

title: Bibyaano
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: In a faraway village, there was a very beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. It was difficult for the parents to decide on a right suitor for their daughter. However, in their compound, they also had a very sweet fruit. They decided that their daughter would be given to whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit. Many young men came to their home to try to win the young, beautiful girl for themselves. Who overcame the test to win the young girl's hand in marriage?

title: Bibyaano
author: /author/shakira-bodio

Her parents decided that their daughter would marry whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.  Who would overcame the test to win the girl's hand in marriage?

title: Kisirusiru, the foolish one
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand him. One day his father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother went with her son. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Patí éfɨ́
author: /author/shakira-bodio
summary: There was a beautiful girl whom everyone wished to marry. In her family compound, there was a tree with delicious fruit. Her parents decided that their daughter would marry whoever visited them and stayed the whole day without eating any of the fruit.  Who would overcame the test to win the girl's hand in marriage?

title: Old rooster
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: Four elderly animals join together to liberate themselves from their ungrateful owners, and find a place to live out their old age peacefully.

title: Kisurusur, Ekabang’abang’at
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: There was once a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. As they looked for a place to set up their new home, they encountered some thieves who had a lot of stolen money and some household goods. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: Lukano lwa Kusilu
author: /author/cissy-kiwanuka-luyiga
summary: Once upon a time, there was a young boy who never seemed to do anything right. His mother was tolerant, but his father could not understand. One day he annoyed his father so much that he could not tolerate him any longer. The father decided to send his son away from home. The boy’s mother decided to go with her son. They walked for very long as they looked for a place where they could set up their new home. By night time, they were tired and they decided to climb up a tree and sleep there till morning. However, as they were settling in, they heard some noise down below. They became so frightened when they looked down and saw some fierce men that they let their door fall. The men had lots of goods with them. What happened to Kisirusiru and his mother?

title: The Honeyguide’s  revenge
author: /author/zulu-folktale
summary: A young hunter follows a honey-guide bird to a bees’ hive full of ripe honey. Instead of rewarding the bird with a share of the honey, he chases it away. The next time the young man tries to find honey, the bird gets its revenge!

title: Intsilihaasa iy’omwoolesi we bubuukhi
author: /author/zulu-folktale
summary: A young hunter follows the lead of a honeyguide bird to a bees’ hive full of ripe honey. Instead of rewarding the bird with a share of the honey, he chases it away. The next time the young man tries to find honey, the bird gets his revenge!

title: The Honeyguide's revenge

title:
Ukuziphindiselela 
kweNgede

title: The wise man
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: A young man believes that youth know better than their elders. His father-in-law, an old man, has different ideas about the matter!

title: The girl with one breast
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: One day a man met a beautiful woman in the forest. Although he was married he immediately fell in love with the woman and wanted to marry her. She told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She asks him to cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they will marry.

title: Mwĩĩtu ῦla Waĩna Nondo ĩmwe
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a man who lived happily with his wife. One day he took a walk into the forest. He met with a very beautiful girl. He immediately fell in love with her and wanted to marry her. However, she told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She therefore suggested to him to go and cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they would marry. So the man run as fast as he could to cut off his wife’s breast, and returned to the forest. But he did not find the beautiful girl to give her the breast. He was very perturbed. What happened to this man?

title: Uwe lukyesikyesi ukhaanyalisa khukhwiwonesa umweene ta
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a young man who thought he was wiser than anyone young or old around him. He said so to everyone including his wife. However, his wife’s father proved to him that “old is wiser than young”.

title: Bunty and Bubbly
author: /author/sorit-gupto
summary: Bunty likes to play but she does not like soap and refuses to clean up. One night she has a dream about germs. Will her dream change her mind about getting clean?

title: Ubhanti no Bhabli
author: /author/sorit-gupto
summary: Bunty likes to play but she does not like soap and refuses to clean up. One night she has a dream about germs. Will her dream change her mind about getting clean?

author: /author/moeketsi-buku
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. Have you ever listened to what your body tells you?

title: Mamela kumzimba wam
author: /author/noni
summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

title: Goso Eketataman
author: /author/tanzanian-folktale
summary: This is a story of a beloved teacher named Goso who taught children under a calabash tree. One day Paa the hungry Gazelle went to steal some fruit hanging from the calabash tree. He shook the tree so hard that the fruit fell on Goso’s head and killed him instantly. The children were very upset and wanted to find out who had killed their teacher.

title: The Clever Little Bird
author: /author/south-african-folktale
summary: The birds want a king, just like the other animals, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a very little bird tricks him. In the end, do the birds get their king?

title: Umuyiinga we Binywiinywi

title: The happy revival
author: /author/rebecca-njuguna
summary: Olokwango hill and the Kwere plains are a good environment for animals and people. But human actions destroy this environment, and people have to learn a difficult lesson about the importance of respecting nature.

title: Kuthaukywa kwa Utanu
author: /author/stephen-musyoka
summary: River Temu flourished and was a source of life for both people and animals until Matata ruined it.  It was eventually revived by a new leader.

title: The blacksmith's dilemma
author: /author/ugandan-folktale
summary: A local chief summoned a famous blacksmith to his palace. The chief wanted the blacksmith to build a real man out of steel, one who could cry tears, and bleed human blood. The blacksmith was alarmed by the chief's request. He knew he could not refuse the chief, but how was he to complete this impossible task?
