title: Apese napei a esikina
author: /author/cornelius-wekunya
summary: There was a man who lived happily with his wife. One day he took a walk into the forest. He met with a very beautiful girl. He immediately fell in love with her and wanted to marry her. However, she told him she could not marry him because she had only one breast. She therefore suggested to him to go and cut off his wife’s breast and bring it to her, and then they would marry. So the man run as fast as he could to cut off his wife’s breast, and returned to the forest. But he did not find the beautiful girl to give her the breast. He was very perturbed. What happened to this man?

title: UTselane nesigebenga
author: /author/lorato-trok
summary: This is a folktale about a little girl called Tselane who is very fond of her childhood village. After the passing of her father, Tselane’s mother wanted them to move to another village to start a new life. Tselane wanted to hear none of it and her mother relented and let her stay on her own while she moved to another village. They made a pact that she will bring Tselane food daily but she must keep the door locked at all times to keep the marauding giants at bay, the only way Tselane should open the door is when she hears her sing her signature song. Somehow the giant did find out that Tselane stayed on her own and he worked on a plan to get into the house and take her to his cave. Will the giant succeed in his plan?

title: Miss Helen’s Magical World
author: /author/jacqui-l%E2%80%99ange
summary:
Helen Martins was an artist who made her imaginary world real. A lonely woman living in a small town, she traveled to faraway places in her mind. She turned her home and garden into a magical creative space. Now, Miss Helen’s ‘Owl House’ in Nieu Bethesda is a National Monument. Many people travel to her former home every year to sit in her Camel Yard among the pilgrims and mermaids, and walk through the glittering glass halls.
This is the story of Helen Martin’s battle against darkness, told by one of the creatures she loved best, the wise old owl.
copyrightHolder: Jacqui L’ange,Wendy Morison, Nadene KrielAnd bookdash.org, 2014

title: Queen of Soweto: The Story of Basetsana Kumalo
author: /author/jessica-taylor
summary: Basetsana Kumalo is a beauty queen, but she’s also so much more. She teaches us that true beauty is about having a heart filled with love and generosity. Her story shows us that if you have courage and determination, you can achieve your dreams –whatever they may be.
copyrightHolder: Jessica Taylor, Mia du Plessis, Marli Fourie and bookdash.org

summary: The hungry jackal sees Crow flying with a piece of cheese in his beak, looking for a tree to enjoy it. Jackal follows Crow and stays under the tree where the crow lands. Jackal makes small talk with Crow pretending to be friendly. What is the jackal’s real mission?

title: Lion's fire sticks
author: /author/traditional-san-story
summary: In the beginning of time only the lion had the power of fire, using his fire sticks. The other animals and people decide they also want the benefits of fire, and make plans to steal the fire sticks.

title: Generous fish
author: /author/kholeka-mabeta
summary: Nosisa lives with her mother and father in a small village. Her father treats her mother badly, and she runs away, leaving her daughter. Nosisa's father marries again and the new wife is cruel to Nosisa. One day the girl takes refuge at a local stream and meets a fish that will change her life.

title: Land of no old people
author: /author/cle%C3%B3fas-samo
summary: In many cultures, old people are valued for their advice and guidance on life’s decisions. In this story, a group of young people get tired of consulting their elders and decide to kill all the old people in the village.

title: Lion that wanted friendship

title: Little Badger goes to the moon
author: /author/melissa-anne-bottcher
summary: Little Badger is a story of a little dog that wants to go the moon. He searches and searches for someone to help him get there but, everyone laughs at him. He then finds Grandpa Garry and together they build a spaceship for an adventure to the moon. Inspired by the daily adventures of my beloved pet schnauzer, Badger.
